The source of the claim: The expert analyzed the source of the claim, which was a Facebook page called I.T Cell MPCC, known to be a fan page of the Congress party. The expert considered the reputation and credibility of this source in evaluating the authenticity of the claim.
Image verification: The expert conducted a reverse image search and found that the photographs used in the claim were not related to the alleged incident in Karnataka. The images were actually from a raid conducted by Income Tax officials in Delhi in November 2017. This aspect of image verification helped in debunking the claim.
Social media circulation: The expert noted that the claim and the accompanying photographs had been widely shared on social media platforms, including Facebook and Twitter. The expert assessed the extent of the circulation and analyzed the different contexts in which the photographs were being used. This aspect helped in understanding the reach and impact of the claim.
Counter: claims and fact-checking: The expert considered the counter-claims and fact-checking articles published by reputable sources, such as The Quint. These counter-claims provided evidence and explanations that contradicted the original claim. The expert evaluated the credibility and accuracy of these counter-claims in order to verify the authenticity of the original claim.
